title: I don't think Riot understands the definition of "Tank" when it comes to balance.
body:
Tank characters are supposed to get beefy, i understand. They get alot of HP and armor/MR and hold the front lines while peeling for your adc. They soak up damage while using their utility to help their team.

Is that not what a tank is? Am I wrong? Isn't that how everyone classifies tanks?

So why does every champ that's listed as a tank in this game pack so much power they can single handedly win team fights? If your going to call someone a "Tank" then you cant give them power behind their survivability it just doesn't make sense, its throws any balance their was away. Survivability + Raw damage =/= balanced.

{{champion:420}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:58}} (( {{champion:223}}  <==== Especially this asshole)) {{champion:106}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:57}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:102}} 

These are all champs that get incredibly tank but can also burst down most champs in a single combo. Throw in stuns and snares and all that other crap ton CC and you have a real problem. How do you honestly fight champs like these? champs that can dive in to an entire enemy team and also be the main source of damage?

One of the first rules of league i was taught when I started was "Never focus the tank, take out the damage dealers like the ADC or the mid laner."

But what do you do when the damage dealers ARE the tanks? There is not a whole lot.

Cmon man lol... They are all tanks, at least semi- tanks with full qualities of tanks (at least most of them). Can we not make such a big deal out of someone not saying "tanks/ fighters/ bruisers/ juggernauts" when they just mean champs that are tanky? 

And if they are not tanks but still have all qualities of a tank (suvivability and CC), doesnt that make them even more op? Because they are fighters with a lot of damage AND tanks?

Except that was never the argument OP is making:

>Tank characters are supposed to get beefy, i understand. They get alot of HP and armor/MR and hold the front lines **while peeling for your adc. They soak up damage while using their utility to help their team.**

Illaoi for example literally has none of the defensive features of a Tank you or OP are pointing out. OP even goes specifically out of his way to use the legitimate definition of a _Tank_ instead of complaining about champs that just happen to be Tanky. This is not a matter of semantics at this point, we know what OP is complaining about and we know that he is wrong.

Illaoi doesnt have utility, but she can peel for her carries with damage. And bruisers like Darius or Garen can soak up damage just as well as "tanks", if not even better. 
And he isnt wrong at all. Even if most champs he listed arent "tanks" (if their secondary role is "tank", why cant people call them tanks?), they are still tankY, they still build no, or just one, "damage" items. So why should they be allowed to have such high damage? 
I understand champs like Illaoi that pay with mobility and utility, but some dont do that.

Tanks in lol have either strong utility or some damage.

The problem with them _just_ being tanky, and nothing else, is that the enemy can just ignore them. That would lead to tanks being useless.

(Survivability+Raw damage)-Utility=Balanced
(Raw damage+Utility)-Survivability=Balanced
(Utility+Survivability)-Raw damage=Balanced

When you break that basic set of guidelines, that is when champ become broken. The thing is, no champ lacks in one of those departments entirely, they are more like a set of sliders that need to be adjusted to maintain balance.
